message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CY, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of securely collecting and matching allegations from multiple individuals, while maintaining their anonymity until a certain threshold is reached. This involves cryptographic protocols, authentication, and matching algorithms, which are all relevant to the sub-category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes a novel algorithm for bucketing and matching allegations, which could fall under the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The use of multiple parties with independent interests and motives suggests a potential application of game theory and mechanism design, which could be relevant to the sub-category of computational complexity (cs.CY). The evaluation of a prototype implementation involves machine learning and statistical analysis, which could be relevant to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) or social and information networks (cs.SI).
